Details on NVP implementation of Provider network extension

subject: remove multi_host check for dhcp checksum
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-08-31 14:35:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/linux_net.py'], 'message': "remove multi_host check for dhcp checksum

This removes the conditional check that actives the workaround
for adding dhcp checksums so that dhcp will work with older clients.
This check is necessary for single host configurations as well as
multi host once as some single code configurations (such as devstack)
will have multiple VM's on one machine with a local dhcp server.

This workaround will save a lot of headache with devstack since without
devstack may mysteriously refuse to work because of dhcp problems.

Change-Id: I53e7e285c5b44dfb6880040b5cd5dba24d13a4cc
"}]
commit_message:
remove multi_host check for dhcp checksum

This removes the conditional check that actives the workaround
for adding dhcp checksums so that dhcp will work with older clients.
This check is necessary for single host configurations as well as
multi host once as some single code configurations (such as devstack)
will have multiple VM's on one machine with a local dhcp server.

This workaround will save a lot of headache with devstack since without
devstack may mysteriously refuse to work because of dhcp problems.

Change-Id: I53e7e285c5b44dfb6880040b5cd5dba24d13a4cc

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 170, 'name': 'Mike Perez', 'email': 'thingee@gmail.com', 'username': 'thingee'}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-19 20:17:19.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/volume/xml/volumes_client.py'], 'message': 'Consider lc string for bootable True/False

The xml.volumes_client check to translate the bootable
setting on a volume object only checks for Upper case strings
and bools.

It turns out that this test was introduced after a bug was introduced
to cinder.api which inadvertently changed the type used to set this
member field.  We now have a patch to fix this and put it back to "true/false"
(lc strings) but since the change there's a tempest test that verifies this.

This patch will check for string true/false either lc or uc, and will
keep the bool check in place as well (otherwise everything will fail).

This test did such a great job we should consider removing the other options
for true/false representations which would've caught the original error introduced
in Cinder (reference cinder lp# 1227837.

Fixes bug: 1227858

Change-Id: I8a4b1f4ce3a6a420e8152ea8c66a9b3fc127fe96
'}]
commit_message:
Consider lc string for bootable True/False

The xml.volumes_client check to translate the bootable
setting on a volume object only checks for Upper case strings
and bools.

It turns out that this test was introduced after a bug was introduced
to cinder.api which inadvertently changed the type used to set this
member field.  We now have a patch to fix this and put it back to "true/false"
(lc strings) but since the change there's a tempest test that verifies this.

This patch will check for string true/false either lc or uc, and will
keep the bool check in place as well (otherwise everything will fail).

This test did such a great job we should consider removing the other options
for true/false representations which would've caught the original error introduced
in Cinder (reference cinder lp# 1227837.

Fixes bug: 1227858

Change-Id: I8a4b1f4ce3a6a420e8152ea8c66a9b3fc127fe96

commit_message:
Replace OpenStack LLC with OpenStack Foundation

Some files still use trademark OpenStack LLC in header, which
should be changed to OpenStack Foundation.

NOTE: tools/install_venv.py is not synced from oslo-incubator, so
it is modified too.

Change-Id: I0084684ff5225076291fea857eb010d638291bd0
Fixes-Bug: #1214176

subject: Update default db username to keystone
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-09-11 06:52:08.000000000', 'files': ['tests/site.pp', 'manifests/db/postgresql.pp', 'spec/classes/keystone_db_postgresql_spec.rb', 'manifests/db/mysql.pp', 'spec/classes/keystone_db_mysql_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Update default db username to keystone

The current default db username for keystone is
keystone_admin. This is inconsistent with the default
db username for every other service which use the
same name as the name of the service.

The documented installation instruction for keystone
also use keystone as the database user.

This commit updates the default to use keystone instead of
keyston_admin.

Change-Id: I1cfaf3fbbc691ff9dbef415b69492f9f965dc113
'}]
commit_message:
Update default db username to keystone

The current default db username for keystone is
keystone_admin. This is inconsistent with the default
db username for every other service which use the
same name as the name of the service.

The documented installation instruction for keystone
also use keystone as the database user.

This commit updates the default to use keystone instead of
keyston_admin.

Change-Id: I1cfaf3fbbc691ff9dbef415b69492f9f965dc113

subject: reschedule_or_error will detach other instances' volumes on Cinder side
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2013-09-12 13:38:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "reschedule_or_error will detach other instances' volumes on Cinder side

When a user creates (in error) an instance using volumes
 which is already in use by another instance,
the error is correctly detected.
But the _reschedule_or_error function will incorrectly
 detach all BDM-volumes given in request, regardless off
 whether each volume had been attached to instance or not.

So we need a protection here,
volume-rollback would only permit to detach the volume
 which is truly belonging to the instance.

Fixes bug: 1215012
Change-Id: Ic0b3527bb68ccf151f31252c931e79193cc6f579
"}]
commit_message:
reschedule_or_error will detach other instances' volumes on Cinder side

When a user creates (in error) an instance using volumes
 which is already in use by another instance,
the error is correctly detected.
But the _reschedule_or_error function will incorrectly
 detach all BDM-volumes given in request, regardless off
 whether each volume had been attached to instance or not.

So we need a protection here,
volume-rollback would only permit to detach the volume
 which is truly belonging to the instance.

Fixes bug: 1215012
Change-Id: Ic0b3527bb68ccf151f31252c931e79193cc6f579

commit_message:
Change usage of assertTrue / assertFalse

The usage of assertTrue() is to be changed to assertIn,
assertIsNone, assertEquals where ever return is not explicit boolean

Change-Id: Ia9b6a6e4fe213392da7db7f5ead37963bf5c9656
Fixes: bug #1218713

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-13 21:45:29.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/test_constraints.py', 'swift/common/constraints.py'], 'message': 'Removes leading slash on X-Object-Manifest value

The swift api currently returns a 400 value when submitting a
X-Object-Manifest beginning with a /.

This strips the leading slash from the X-Object-Manifest value.

This also removes the test case that checks for a bad http request
returned.

Users can now submit X-Object-Manifest values with a leading slash.

Fixes: bug #1191958
Change-Id: I2711c2fa634ba8b47681562b4674235b54ac457a
'}]
commit_message:
Removes leading slash on X-Object-Manifest value

The swift api currently returns a 400 value when submitting a
X-Object-Manifest beginning with a /.

This strips the leading slash from the X-Object-Manifest value.

This also removes the test case that checks for a bad http request
returned.

Users can now submit X-Object-Manifest values with a leading slash.

Fixes: bug #1191958
Change-Id: I2711c2fa634ba8b47681562b4674235b54ac457a

commit_message:
Fix pending_delete images with NULL location

Scrubber needs the location metadata to do cleanup.
However RegistryClient.get_images_detailed() returns
pending_delete images with NULL location.

Fix this by allowing location to be returned for
pending_delete images in db api.

Change-Id: Ib2b666c2f0b5cd9b89120b0650a03777415bbe16
Fixes: bug #1190643

commit_message:
Add Guru Meditation Report Functionality to Apps

Adds Guru Meditation Report hooks to all of the nova components.
Now, all components may be sent SIGUSR1 to print the basic
Guru Meditation Report to stderr

commit_message:
Get ambari mirror with curl instead of wget

That was implemented in 0.2 but wasn't 'backported' back to 0.3.
The rationale is that unlike 'curl', 'wget' is not installed by
default on CentOS

Change-Id: I16c920dcb0b496fd229754c49ba7ed9fe19ad1e8

commit_message:
Update cinder flags with autogenerate tools

Also create new tables cinder-backups_ceph, cinder-backup_swift,
cinder_backups_tsm, cinder-gpfs_volume so that the tables can
be used by these patches:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/47118

Additional tables have been split up so that they can be used
in the configuration reference.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-09-17 10:25:39.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Add ordereddict for python 2.6 compatibility

Glance property protections (bp/api-v2-property-protection) is
predicated on sections in a configuration file being read in the order
they appear.

This is the default behaviour for ConfigParser in Python 2.7, however
for Python 2.6 we need to specify the 'dict_type' parameter
(ref
http://docs.python.org/2/library/configparser.html#ConfigParser.RawConfigParser
)

This dependency can be removed when OpenStack is no longer required to
support Python 2.6.

Change-Id: Iafe9d1ffe2062156c5194b491c7fe55b130a7461
"}]
commit_message:
Add ordereddict for python 2.6 compatibility

Glance property protections (bp/api-v2-property-protection) is
predicated on sections in a configuration file being read in the order
they appear.

This is the default behaviour for ConfigParser in Python 2.7, however
for Python 2.6 we need to specify the 'dict_type' parameter
(ref
http://docs.python.org/2/library/configparser.html#ConfigParser.RawConfigParser
)

This dependency can be removed when OpenStack is no longer required to
support Python 2.6.

Change-Id: Iafe9d1ffe2062156c5194b491c7fe55b130a7461

commit_message:
Update tox to use develop and custom pip command

The use_develop option saves time over the sdist/install. More
importantly, install_command allows us to override tox's default
behavior of passing --pre.

Change-Id: Ifb8fc877aa23db38310777912aa6d914ae040178

When an instance is not found by libvirtd, _lookup_by_name in libvirt
driver raises InstanceNotFound. This patch catchs this exception instead
of NotFound who is the father of InstanceNotFound.

Change-Id: I1b4ce8f6c44eef29617a42151152cda2159a0088

commit_message:
Catch more accuracy exception for _lookup_by_name

When an instance is not found by libvirtd, _lookup_by_name in libvirt
driver raises InstanceNotFound. This patch catchs this exception instead
of NotFound who is the father of InstanceNotFound.

Closes-Bug: #1222663
Change-Id: I1b4ce8f6c44eef29617a42151152cda2159a0088

subject: Fix HP3PAR iSCSI path connection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-20 15:45:59.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/test_hp3par.py'], 'message': 'Fix HP3PAR iSCSI path connection

The iSCSI paths are not correctly identified as ‘active’
when port information is requested from the hp3parclient
because the ‘active’ value is a Boolean not the string
‘true’.

Fixes Bug #1224594

Change-Id: Ib10563cfc31c0628dc8b1edbba246398a3a11f34
'}]
commit_message:
Fix HP3PAR iSCSI path connection

The iSCSI paths are not correctly identified as ‘active’
when port information is requested from the hp3parclient
because the ‘active’ value is a Boolean not the string
‘true’.

Fixes Bug #1224594

commit_message:
Fix problem with starting Windows 7 instances using VMware Driver

The default controller for a Windows 7 virtual machine is the
LSI Logic SAS. When the disk adapter type is specified as 'lsiLogic'
via glance image metadata, VMware driver defaults to LSI Logic Parallel
controller. With this fix the driver will honor a property 'lsiLogicsas'
to distinguish the right adapter and enable booting Windows instances.

Fixes: bug #1187853
Change-Id: Idb36a784a31e4938e8951adeb83335b3890dac85

commit_message:
Implement unix domain socket consoles for libvirt

For this change to work for you, you'll need to either disable
apparmor or alter the libvirt templates to allow access to
/tmp. You also need to change the value of the
console_log_type flag to "domain". Console logs are then passed
from libvirt to nova-compute with a unix domain socket. This
allows us to implement console log file rotation.

This change also makes the way file system elements are shared
with libvirt configurable. You can specify a chmod value for
those elements (the previous implementation), or a group to
chgrp to which is shared by nova-compute and libvirt. If
neither option is specified, nova-compute will refuse to start
if using the libvirt hypervisor driver.

This change also slightly refactors how all console logging in
libvirt works, but there are no functional changes to "file"
style logging.

New flags:
    console_log_type
    max_rotated_consoles

    libvirt_shared_file_mode
    libvirt_shared_group
    libvirt_shared_noop

DocImpact

SecurityImpact: this should reduce the amount of unbounded
growth we see in libvirt console log files.

Closes-Bug: 832507
Closes-Bug: 1227027
Progresses blueprint fix-libvirt-console-logging

This review squashes a series of previous reviews down to one.
Previous change ids are:
    I6d65acf74e6d2734c16ccea243b3110a97e7f792
    I70e0e21a99fe45dcb2ee3733f382e8f1d0302905
    I5d1cb79375a2ed509262f19af93fa2946e1edf3c

Change-Id: I3513c12ed446171cfba819d8513616a70c983877

commit_message:
xenapi: Make rescue safer

If rescue setup fails, detach the root disk from the rescue VM so it
doesn't get nuked by the undo stack logic in spawn()

bug 1227898

Change-Id: I8864b4c524f04f7b387be1018fea9919a461c48b

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2013-09-20 16:51:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: ignore false exception due to slow NFS on resize-revert

When resize revert one VM instance, if the NFS is slow, the NFS
mounted on source host might not respond quickly. This will cause
that even if the VM instance configuration files was deleted from
resize target host, the NFS on source host may still think the
files were not deleted. Then in driver.py::finish_revert_migration,
the driver try to delete the file again, this will lead nova compute
throw exception.

The fix was ignore exception for such case: if failed to delete the
instance with error no as 2 (No such file or directory)

Fix bug 1206312

Change-Id: I89990c1750a7fd7f421cab03780e7704ee661de1
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: ignore false exception due to slow NFS on resize-revert

When resize revert one VM instance, if the NFS is slow, the NFS
mounted on source host might not respond quickly. This will cause
that even if the VM instance configuration files was deleted from
resize target host, the NFS on source host may still think the
files were not deleted. Then in driver.py::finish_revert_migration,
the driver try to delete the file again, this will lead nova compute
throw exception.

The fix was ignore exception for such case: if failed to delete the
instance with error no as 2 (No such file or directory)

Fix bug 1206312

Change-Id: I89990c1750a7fd7f421cab03780e7704ee661de1

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-09-20 18:32:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': "Actually fix info_cache healing lazy load

system_metadata is still being lazy loaded as a part of healing the
instance info_cache.  A previous attempt to fix this issue missed the
more important call.

It's actually more efficient to not load the system_metadata when getting
the list and allow the 1 instance to lazy load.  For the cached instances,
we will ask for system_metadata when getting a fresh copy from the DB.

Fixes bug 1223969

Change-Id: Ib95e868135ed2b36af7ddbcfb8d5905bfe14d1fe
"}]
commit_message:
Actually fix info_cache healing lazy load

system_metadata is still being lazy loaded as a part of healing the
instance info_cache.  A previous attempt to fix this issue missed the
more important call.

It's actually more efficient to not load the system_metadata when getting
the list and allow the 1 instance to lazy load.  For the cached instances,
we will ask for system_metadata when getting a fresh copy from the DB.

Fixes bug 1223969

Change-Id: Ib95e868135ed2b36af7ddbcfb8d5905bfe14d1fe

commit_message:
Configurable libvirt sharing options

Previously we have assumed that we just chmod everything which
needs to be shared with libvirt to 777. This change makes that
configurable.

DocImpact: adds two flags (libvirt_shared_file_mode and
libvirt_shared_group) which let you specify what is needed for
nova-compute to share filesystem elements with libvirt.

Progresses blueprint fix-libvirt-console-logging.

Change-Id: I5d1cb79375a2ed509262f19af93fa2946e1edf3c

commit_message:
Implement file rotate for unix domain console logging

This change adds console log file rotation to the unix domain
socket logging implementation. It also slightly refactors the
way file logging is handled, but there are no functional changes.

Resolves bug 832507, progresses blueprint fix-libvirt-console-logging.

DocImpact: console log files are now rotated if unix domain
socket logging is turned on.

SecurityImpact: this should reduce the amount of unbounded
growth we see in libvirt console log files.

Change-Id: I0fd2f225c7637eb95d82e5dc465313cb7b5c0620

commit_message:
Add support for unix domain sockets as console logs

This is the first step in offering interactive consoles via libvirt.

DocImpact: For this change to work for you, you'll need to either
disable apparmor or alter the libvirt templates to allow access to
/tmp. You also need to change the value of the console_log_type flag
to "domain".

Sneaks up on bug 832507, progresses blueprint fix-libvirt-console-logging.

Change-Id: I6d65acf74e6d2734c16ccea243b3110a97e7f792

commit_message:
Limit resources per stack in nested stacks

In an earlier patch, the root stack creation was limited by the
max_resources_per_stack config setting. Now we need to apply the same
limit for nested stacks.

commit_message:
Provide config option to limit resources per stack

This provides an upper bounds on the number of resources a root level
stack can contain. The limitation is only applied to the engine creation
point so that existing stacks that are over the limit in the database
will not cause problems. Nested stacks will be addressed in a follow-up
patch.

Partial-Bug: #1215100
Change-Id: I1adcb22cf9bd5750b4ae3f219dd3264d1d02c1fc

commit_message:

The snapshot operation was failing because it calls
VirtualDiskManager.CopyVirtualDisk with a destination disk spec, which
is not supported when called through VC. The fix is to not supply a spec
when calling through VC, in which case the disk is consolidated and
copied without type transformation.

While the fix is to use spec-less CopyVirtualDisk in VC, doing so in ESX

Another issue found and fixed is that the name of the snapshot image is

commit_message:
Fix snapshot failure with VMwareVCDriver

The snapshot operation was failing because it calls
VirtualDiskManager.CopyVirtualDisk with a destination disk spec, which
is not supported when called through VC. The fix is to not supply a spec
when calling through VC, in which case the disk is consolidated and
copied without type transformation.

While the fix is to use spec-less CopyVirtualDisk in VC, doing so in ESX
too will result in unintended transformation (because it ESX will
default to busLogic/preallocated), so the use of the spec was retained
in ESX-mode instead.

Another issue found and fixed is that the name of the snapshot image is
incorrectly set when uploading to glance.

The following tempest tests are now unbroken against the VC and ESX
nodes:
  tempest.api.compute.images.
     test_images_oneserver.ImagesOneServerTest{JSON,XML}.
        test_create_delete_image
        test_create_second_image_when_first_image_is_being_saved
        test_delete_image_of_another_tenant
     test_list_image_filters
  tempest.api.compute.test_authorization.AuthorizationTestJSON
  tempest.api.compute.test_authorization.AuthorizationTestXML

Fixes bug 1184807

Change-Id: I7ec49859fb2842cc02cdc87a6434aa58612a2964

commit_message:
Fix for os-availability-zone/detail returning 500

if there are no enabled_services, then zone_hosts is very likely
to be empty, which means zone_hosts['nova'] will fail. So let's
use get with a default of empty array to cover this case. Added
a fix/test for v3 API as well.

Fixes LP# 1226791

Change-Id: I602c96242291fd9a4bdf67af6445aa935ec7f7e3

commit_message:
Fix unsuitable assertTrue

assertTrue accepts a parameter msg which will be printed when
assertion fails, usually msg is a str. This patch fixes unsuitable
usage of assertTrue which set msg to bool type True.

Change-Id: I731f8ea553c935eba0e112ffded16f41a5ea86c0
Fixes-Bug: #1226374

subject: xenapi: regroup spawn steps for better progress
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5044, 'name': 'Mate Lakat', 'email': 'mlakat@suse.com', 'username': 'mate-lakat'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 8430, 'name': 'Christopher Lefelhocz', 'email': 'christopher.lefelhoc@rackspace.com', 'username': 'leif'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2013-08-30 18:10:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/virt/xenapi/test_vmops.py'], 'message': 'xenapi: regroup spawn steps for better progress

Currently the operations are not very logically grouped. Now we can see
all the individual actions more clearly, we can re-arrange the
operations so each step make more sense, and should be better at
reporting progress.

Rather than checking very late that there is no duplicate VM and enough
memory, I have moved these checks before the expensive operation of
downloading the disk.

After this change there are 10 clear steps during spawn:
* initial step so progress is not zero during download disks
* download and create disks step
* download and create kernel and ramdisk step
* create the VM record, now the disks have been downloaded
* setup the disks; resizingi up disk, and attaching, adding rescue disk
* injecting instance data, currently this means writing to xenstore
* setting up the networking, including the initial firewall setup
* starting the VM and waiting for it to boot
* configuring the VM using the agent (takes a long time on windows)
* applying the final firewall filters, now the VM is running

With this in place, it will be easy to decide which steps are required
and which are not required when reusing the spawn code to implement
finish_migration in a later change.

Change-Id: I0e33dd7d298390630f632e116c8866a64e769102
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: regroup spawn steps for better progress

Currently the operations are not very logically grouped. Now we can see
all the individual actions more clearly, we can re-arrange the
operations so each step make more sense, and should be better at
reporting progress.

Rather than checking very late that there is no duplicate VM and enough
memory, I have moved these checks before the expensive operation of
downloading the disk.

After this change there are 10 clear steps during spawn:
* initial step so progress is not zero during download disks
* download and create disks step
* download and create kernel and ramdisk step
* create the VM record, now the disks have been downloaded
* setup the disks; resizingi up disk, and attaching, adding rescue disk
* injecting instance data, currently this means writing to xenstore
* setting up the networking, including the initial firewall setup
* starting the VM and waiting for it to boot
* configuring the VM using the agent (takes a long time on windows)
* applying the final firewall filters, now the VM is running

With this in place, it will be easy to decide which steps are required
and which are not required when reusing the spawn code to implement
finish_migration in a later change.

Change-Id: I0e33dd7d298390630f632e116c8866a64e769102

subject: xenapi: stop injecting the hostname during resize
revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2013-08-30 18:10:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/virt/xenapi/test_vmops.py'], 'message': 'xenapi: stop injecting the hostname during resize

The windows PV tools will set the hostname of a server to the value
given in the hostname xenstore key. If we inject that during resize, the
users will be unable to change their server hostname, and in addition it
will be reset to the original name.

Fixes bug 1207829
Change-Id: I49ba9d9f4f8b4a86488e427d99f69236bd959c78
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: stop injecting the hostname during resize

The windows PV tools will set the hostname of a server to the value
given in the hostname xenstore key. If we inject that during resize, the
users will be unable to change their server hostname, and in addition it
will be reset to the original name.

Fixes bug 1207829
Change-Id: I49ba9d9f4f8b4a86488e427d99f69236bd959c78

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-09-20 03:38:23.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/backup/manager.py', 'cinder/tests/test_gpfs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_rbd.py', 'cinder/volume/flows/create_volume/__init__.py', 'cinder/exception.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py', 'cinder/utils.py', 'cinder/tests/test_backup.py'], 'message': "Enforce driver is initialized

This updates the volume manager and the
backup manager to enforce that the driver
has been initialized.

The managers call the driver in many places
without ensuring that the driver has been
properly initialized.   When the driver fails
inside of do_setup(), the managers shouldn't
call the driver's set_initialized() method.
The managers now dump out the exception, and

commit_message:
Enforce driver is initialized

This updates the volume manager and the
backup manager to enforce that the driver
has been initialized.

The managers call the driver in many places
without ensuring that the driver has been
properly initialized.   When the driver fails
inside of do_setup(), the managers shouldn't
call the driver's set_initialized() method.
The managers now dump out the exception, and
exit the init_host, leaving the driver in
an uninitialized state.

Fixes bug #1225897

Change-Id: I77b947f2a9fbe1b38f321511dba10fcd2fe1fe90

commit_message:
Allow to specify default provides at task definition

It is now possible to specify what task provides when task class
(deriving from taskflow.task.Task) is defined, using 'default_provides'
class attribute or property. This specification may still be overridden
when task instance is created via 'provides' constructor parameter.

Change-Id: If300c3a35807422d06c0196e84891faebde83c02

Change-Id: Id121ebbb59f6a52cc6b1ae6f7e7c6e87f2290035

commit_message:
Distributed (Event-Driven) Engine

Distributed Engine is an engine that can doesn't care about patterns,
only task relations, and runs flows based on those relations.
Because of this, distributed translator is larger than other translators
(as it must account for all possible flows and their relations).

Change-Id: Id121ebbb59f6a52cc6b1ae6f7e7c6e87f2290035

subject: Novaclient shell list command should support a minimal server list
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-09-20 13:59:25.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/shell.py', 'novaclient/v3/shell.py'], 'message': 'Novaclient shell list command should support a minimal server list

The Nova API supports both a basic (id and name) and detailed server
list, and this is supported in the client by the "detailed=True"
argument to servers.list().  However the shell do_list() method always
leaves this to its default value.  For administrators on a large
system, or where the tenants has a lot of instances a detailed list
can be painfully slow.

This change adds support for a --minimal option to list.

Fixes bug: 1228137

Change-Id: I3126ee6b372606a98f0d7a4e344556f8c05ae224
'}]
commit_message:
Novaclient shell list command should support a minimal server list

The Nova API supports both a basic (id and name) and detailed server
list, and this is supported in the client by the "detailed=True"
argument to servers.list().  However the shell do_list() method always
leaves this to its default value.  For administrators on a large
system, or where the tenants has a lot of instances a detailed list
can be painfully slow.

This change adds support for a --minimal option to list.

Fixes bug: 1228137

Change-Id: I3126ee6b372606a98f0d7a4e344556f8c05ae224

subject: Add a flow flattening util
revisions:
[{'number': 33, 'created': '2013-09-20 08:41:56.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/seq_action.py', 'taskflow/test.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/engine.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/parallel_action.py', 'taskflow/utils/graph_utils.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_action_engine.py', 'taskflow/utils/flow_utils.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_flattening.py'], 'message': 'Add a flow flattening util

Instead of recursively executing subflows which causes
dead locks when they parent and subflows share the same
executor we can instead flatten the parent and subflows
into a single graph, composed with only tasks and run
this instead, which will not have the issue of subflows
dead locking, since after flattening there is no concept
of a subflow.

Fixes bug: 1225759

Change-Id: I79b9b194cd81e36ce75ba34a673e3e9d3e96c4cd
'}]
commit_message:
Add a flow flattening util

Instead of recursively executing subflows which causes
dead locks when they parent and subflows share the same
executor we can instead flatten the parent and subflows
into a single graph, composed with only tasks and run
this instead, which will not have the issue of subflows
dead locking, since after flattening there is no concept
of a subflow.

Fixes bug: 1225759

Change-Id: I79b9b194cd81e36ce75ba34a673e3e9d3e96c4cd

subject: gettextutils: port to Python 3
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 5343, 'name': 'Mathew Odden', 'username': 'mrodden', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 5371, 'name': 'Mathew Odden', 'email': 'locke105@gmail.com', 'username': 'locke105'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-09-20 08:20:38.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_gettext.py', 'openstack/common/gettextutils.py'], 'message': "gettextutils: port to Python 3

- Everything's unicode in Python 3, so ugettext() has been removed.
  Let's use gettext() instead.
- Don't rely on builtins, and fix various unicode compatibility.
- Simplify check if a dict as params works; the test MIGHT work most
  of the time, but there is _no_ guarantee that str(somedict) returns
  always the result; in Python 3, sometimes the keys are iterated in a
  different order, returning a different result. Since anyway the dict
  is converted using str(), there's no really point for this test.
  We just a dict with one item to avoid the item order issue.

Change-Id: I1fc8991b3387dd56627b9f7f7833d2971cab059f
"}]
commit_message:
gettextutils: port to Python 3

- Everything's unicode in Python 3, so ugettext() has been removed.
  Let's use gettext() instead.
- Don't rely on builtins, and fix various unicode compatibility.
- Simplify check if a dict as params works; the test MIGHT work most
  of the time, but there is _no_ guarantee that str(somedict) returns
  always the result; in Python 3, sometimes the keys are iterated in a
  different order, returning a different result. Since anyway the dict
  is converted using str(), there's no really point for this test.
  We just a dict with one item to avoid the item order issue.

Change-Id: I1fc8991b3387dd56627b9f7f7833d2971cab059f

The current code is missing a flag to pool_migrate that should be
included to ensure the migrate is live. This change adds that flag to
both uses of VM.pool_migrate, namely the live-migrate call and the

commit_message:
xenapi: ensure pool based migrate is live

The current code is missing a flag to pool_migrate that should be
included to ensure the migrate is live. This change adds that flag to
both uses of VM.pool_migrate, namely the live-migrate call and the
host_maintenance call.

Fixes bug 1201795
Change-Id: I265baaba5e9bd9132bd5e1c6f9fb18cefab02cfb

subject: Make os-apply-config read on-disk config files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-19 17:08:38.000000000', 'files': ['os_apply_config/tests/test_apply_config.py', 'README.md', 'os_apply_config/apply_config.py'], 'message': 'Make os-apply-config read on-disk config files

os-collect-config was changed recently to save the list of collected
files on disk, and not just in OS_CONFIG_FILES. This will allow
os-apply-config to be run outside of os-collect-config and still have
access to the latest copies of collected metadata.

Change-Id: I520f1332e5789e24562300f38af02b37a062ab48
'}]
commit_message:
Make os-apply-config read on-disk config files

os-collect-config was changed recently to save the list of collected
files on disk, and not just in OS_CONFIG_FILES. This will allow
os-apply-config to be run outside of os-collect-config and still have
access to the latest copies of collected metadata.

Change-Id: I520f1332e5789e24562300f38af02b37a062ab48

commit_message:
Make run_tests.sh identify requirements correctly

We need to check requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt
in parallel to ensure both are satisfied and we don't upgrade
a package beyond requirements.txt's limits when installing
dependencies for test-requirements.txt

Fixes bug: 1227019

Change-Id: I606f8a1d3eed5c270d5b3c154994d5c3a17b98c8

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2013-09-17 15:47:38.000000000', 'files': ['etc/tempest.conf.sample', 'tempest/config.py', 'tempest/api/object_storage/test_container_quotas.py'], 'message': "Adds tests covering Swift's container quotas middleware

The execution of the tests is conditional to a setting declared
in the config file (container_quotas_available by default to True).

There are 3 tests:
 + User uploads an object smaller than the quota successfully
 + User fails to upload an object larger than the bytes quota
 + User fails to upload many objects that exceeds the count limit

Closes-Bug: 1225891
Change-Id: Id93f6c3628624f115a3c7a91de8a8e7894003f3f
"}]
commit_message:
Adds tests covering Swift's container quotas middleware

The execution of the tests is conditional to a setting declared
in the config file (container_quotas_available by default to True).

There are 3 tests:
 + User uploads an object smaller than the quota successfully
 + User fails to upload an object larger than the bytes quota
 + User fails to upload many objects that exceeds the count limit

Closes-Bug: 1225891
Change-Id: Id93f6c3628624f115a3c7a91de8a8e7894003f3f

commit_message:
Adds EDP support in the UI for job execution

First pass at job execution in the UI.  Job binaries
tab has been added, still needs work to handle internal
and external sources as well as overall refinement of controls.
Now includes job_binaries as a form rather than a workflow and
forces a unique name for binary-internal uploads.

Implements: blueprint edp-savanna-dashboard-ui

Change-Id: Id32f7c5d5458918bd832070c53271c042d886f86

subject: Fix timeutils.set_override_time not defaulting to current wall time
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1994, 'name': 'Zhongyue Luo', 'email': 'zhongyue.luo@gmail.com', 'username': 'zyluo'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6944, 'name': 'Allele Dev', 'email': 'cpp.cabrera@gmail.com', 'username': 'cpp-cabrera'}, {'_account_id': 7996, 'name': 'Luis A. Garcia', 'email': 'luis@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'luisg'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-19 21:25:07.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/timeutils.py', 'tests/unit/test_timeutils.py'], 'message': 'Fix timeutils.set_override_time not defaulting to current wall time

This patch modifies timeutils.set_override_time so that it does not
default to setting the override to the current time when the function
*definition* is executed, but rather defaults to using the current
time at the moment the function is *called*.

The thinking is that this behavior is more along the lines of what
the developer would expect when using this function. The new behavior
is called out explicitly in the docstring.

Change-Id: I5a2d449c76a392c902d7a89617d63d7f1e896276
'}]
commit_message:
Fix timeutils.set_override_time not defaulting to current wall time

This patch modifies timeutils.set_override_time so that it does not
default to setting the override to the current time when the function
*definition* is executed, but rather defaults to using the current
time at the moment the function is *called*.

The thinking is that this behavior is more along the lines of what
the developer would expect when using this function. The new behavior
is called out explicitly in the docstring.

Change-Id: I5a2d449c76a392c902d7a89617d63d7f1e896276

commit_message:
Add a test for creation of volumes' snapshots.

A new test called 'test_snapshot_create_get_delete' is added.
Also adds setUpClass and tearDownClass methods to create a
shareable volume origin.
Finally updates the existing 'test_volume_from_snapshot' which
now uses the create_* and clear_* wrappers from base class and
the shareable volume origin from setUpClass method.

Change-Id: I3fb8edabaf4649736a43d6de5a9c4518d3caac62
Implements: blueprint add-snapshot-tests
(cherry picked from commit 7333293fb549cb88a26246ddcd2f0c6bc812ce74)

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2013-09-14 08:55:19.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/test_authorization.py', 'tempest/common/rest_client.py', 'tempest/services/compute/xml/images_client.py', 'tempest/api/compute/images/test_images.py', 'tempest/api/compute/images/test_image_metadata.py', 'tempest/api/compute/images/test_list_image_filters.py', 'tempest/exceptions.py', 'tempest/api/compute/images/test_images_oneserver.py', 'tempest/services/compute/json/images_client.py'], 'message': "Remove wait_for_image_resp_code

The nova api first creates an entry in glance,
before responding to snapshot creation request, so the entry
expected to be visible without any additional wait.

This change also introduces an OK code checker on the rest_client side,
it's extended usage can make unnecessary to assert the ok codes in the
test codes.

So the wait_for_image_status will implicitly validate the status code.

Change-Id: I9fdc1cc68501220e6688e2d7a745195b56d60cb9
"}]
commit_message:
Remove wait_for_image_resp_code

The nova api first creates an entry in glance,
before responding to snapshot creation request, so the entry
expected to be visible without any additional wait.

This change also introduces an OK code checker on the rest_client side,
it's extended usage can make unnecessary to assert the ok codes in the
test codes.

So the wait_for_image_status will implicitly validate the status code.

Change-Id: I9fdc1cc68501220e6688e2d7a745195b56d60cb9

This patchset skips test_token test due to the change of 401 response
for an invalid token to a 404 response.  Keystone bug 1221889.

Once the change to keystone has been accepted, a subsequent patchset
will be proposed to tempest to renable the check and accept the new
404 HTTP status for the get_token call on invalid tokens.

'}]
commit_message:
Skip test tokens

This patchset skips test_token test due to the change of 401 response
for an invalid token to a 404 response.  Keystone bug 1221889.

Once the change to keystone has been accepted, a subsequent patchset
will be proposed to tempest to renable the check and accept the new
404 HTTP status for the get_token call on invalid tokens.

related-bug: 1221889
Change-Id: I3c5691f5085e10e28b0f57505133ae3478167396

subject: This adds a transport layer request spec class.  The idea here is to be declarative i.e. specify *what* is desired. It's up to the respective transport to turn a request spec into an appropriate request.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-09-20 08:26:02.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/transport/test_request.py', 'marconiclient/common/__init__.py', 'marconiclient/transport/request.py', 'marconiclient/common/utils.py'], 'message': "This adds a transport layer request spec class.  The idea here is to be
declarative i.e. specify *what* is desired. It's up to the respective
transport to turn a request spec into an appropriate request.

The request spec class also performs some basic request validation.
My assumption is that the Marconi API is stable and known for a given
version. I am hence capturing the API info for version 1 in the code and
not fetching the home document.

Nevertheless I have introduced a separate api_info() function that
allows us to source the API info via the home document at a later point.

Change-Id: I8e30a2e09c6672f291149e02dbe3a78795b41931
"}]
commit_message:
This adds a transport layer request spec class.  The idea here is to be
declarative i.e. specify *what* is desired. It's up to the respective
transport to turn a request spec into an appropriate request.

The request spec class also performs some basic request validation.
My assumption is that the Marconi API is stable and known for a given
version. I am hence capturing the API info for version 1 in the code and
not fetching the home document.

Nevertheless I have introduced a separate api_info() function that
allows us to source the API info via the home document at a later point.

Change-Id: I8e30a2e09c6672f291149e02dbe3a78795b41931

commit_message:
Creates an empty init script override file if necessary

Without this patch, puppet runs were failing with the following error:

(/Stage[main]/Cinder::Volume::Rbd/File_line[set initscript env]) Could not
evaluate: No such file or directory - /etc/init/cinder-volume.override

Change-Id: Ibf42b4b09441c8a044f50af62246be31fe584e1b

commit_message:
Port with DHCP Device required

DHCP Agent will continue to create dhcp port
when a port without dhcp device exists.
This causes unintended conflicts, reuse
existing port that is not attached to device.

Fixes: bug #1219795
Depends on Change-Id: Ib2a934e8d9f792e9a7aff7d3554e5d3d1ba0b962

Change-Id: I6d3c991046221e50c9fe4d9a11c92f5a553c7ba4

subject: Monkey patch select in environment
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-09-20 00:23:43.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/environment/__init__.py'], 'message': "Monkey patch select in environment

Explicitly say what needs to be monkey patched in
environment/__init__.py. By doing this we are making the code easier to
read and select needs to be monkey patched in order for notifications to
work with keystone/openstack/common/rpc/impl_qpid.py. Without monkey
patching select, keystone will hang on sending a notification since
qpid_messaging won't operate properly when establishing a connection
with the qpid broker.

Change-Id: I4cbdf29924473a76ce459d969e5e7077aac5beb8
Closes-bug: #1224565
"}]
commit_message:
Monkey patch select in environment

Explicitly say what needs to be monkey patched in
environment/__init__.py. By doing this we are making the code easier to
read and select needs to be monkey patched in order for notifications to
work with keystone/openstack/common/rpc/impl_qpid.py. Without monkey
patching select, keystone will hang on sending a notification since
qpid_messaging won't operate properly when establishing a connection
with the qpid broker.

Change-Id: I4cbdf29924473a76ce459d969e5e7077aac5beb8
Closes-bug: #1224565

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2013-09-19 15:22:42.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/provider.py', 'keystone/token/core.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend_kvs.py', 'keystone/token/providers/uuid.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend_memcache.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend_sql.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend.py'], 'message': "Ensure v2 tokens are correctly invalidated when using BelongsTo

Due to the optional paramater of the tenant on several v2 token
validation methods, we need to ensure that calling token validation
with different permutations of parameters does not lead to an incorrect
cache value being returned.  This is done by lifting the 'BelongsTo'
checks out of the token backend and into the Manager, in a layer above
where the token caching takes place.

Fixes bug 1226225

Change-Id: Ifa3162923ad41aac6a9e5d5b4996bc43dc9b11fb
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure v2 tokens are correctly invalidated when using BelongsTo

Due to the optional paramater of the tenant on several v2 token
validation methods, we need to ensure that calling token validation
with different permutations of parameters does not lead to an incorrect
cache value being returned.  This is done by lifting the 'BelongsTo'
checks out of the token backend and into the Manager, in a layer above
where the token caching takes place.

Fixes bug 1226225

Change-Id: Ifa3162923ad41aac6a9e5d5b4996bc43dc9b11fb

commit_message:
Cleanup and consolidation of the roles.

The roles were getting extremely fine-grained, to the point where it seemed
unlikely to map to real deployments. Several of these were redundant,
unreferenced or referred to recipes that did not exist so they were removed.

os-block-storage-api.rb: consolidated
os-block-storage-scheduler.rb: consolidated
os-block-storage-worker.rb: invalid
os-compute-api-ec2.rb: consolidated
os-compute-api-metadata.rb: consolidated
os-compute-api-os-compute.rb: consolidated
os-identity-api-admin.rb: unused
os-identity-api.rb: consolidated
os-image-api.rb: consolidated
os-image-registry.rb: consolidated
os-infra-caching.rb: unused
os-object-storage.rb: invalid

The other changes were to accomodate these updates.

Change-Id: Ia9bcc85b3e93ababc3ee6c26957bda2bab7f9809

Rewrite README.rst

Most of the content in the README is unmaintained and out of date, and
can be replaced by references to documentation that *is* more properly
maintained.

This patch replaces most of the contents of the README with
low maintenance links.

Fixes-Bug: 1227734

commit_message:
Encode values as utf-8 before encrypting

Ensure strings are correctly encoded before encrypting

This is necessary because some encryption libraries don't handle
the unicode conversion appropriately.

Change-Id: Iebbf32e57ba21d955c1984ee32360379579366c8
Closes-Bug: #1207707

pci passthrough bug fix:hasattr dones not work for dict

hasattr only work in object model, scheduler does not use the
object model yet. so fall back to dict model.

Closes-Bug: #1226348

Signed-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>

commit_message:
Adding encryption support for image multiple locations

Adding necessary encryption and decryption code to registry API v1
server and client side, in order to take care image's all locations but
single location only.

docImpact
Implement bp: image-location-status
Fixes bug: 1218712

Change-Id: I999426469c196da1094cc46b5237bf1bc2006877
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Add reserved in fixed-ip show API

fixed-ip has show,reserve,unreserve API,
but the show API doesn't return reservation info,
this makes the user hard to know if IP is reserved
or not.

Change-Id: Id36b49639f9b4009cacaeb0d963a34b1d219e468

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-19 20:32:38.000000000', 'files': ['toci_test.sh'], 'message': 'Make all os-collect-config polling distro agnostic

Ubuntu does not support journalctl (which we currently use
in toci_test.sh to poll for os-collect-config to finish).

This patch wraps our os-collect-config polling commands so that distro
specific commands can be used to poll for the events.

NOTE: eventually it would be cool to be able to poll for specific
heat events, etc.

Change-Id: I15db5ab57f32c5f365a702a4a6d20e2debc427bd
'}]
commit_message:
Make all os-collect-config polling distro agnostic

Ubuntu does not support journalctl (which we currently use
in toci_test.sh to poll for os-collect-config to finish).

This patch wraps our os-collect-config polling commands so that distro
specific commands can be used to poll for the events.

NOTE: eventually it would be cool to be able to poll for specific
heat events, etc.

Change-Id: I15db5ab57f32c5f365a702a4a6d20e2debc427bd

size than snapshot and creating cloned vol of
different size than original.

support extreme resizes, since normal resize

commit_message:
NetApp fix create vol different size than snapshot

This fixes the issue of creating vol of different
size than snapshot and creating cloned vol of
different size than original.

This change adds a lot of additional LUN geometry
and sub-LUN cloning code which is neccesary to
support extreme resizes, since normal resize
operations are limitted to be within a certain factor
of the original LUN size.

Closes-Bug:#1098581

Change-Id: I8652bfaa67c12c790fa80650a051497f70279b9c

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 7400, 'name': 'Tracy Jones', 'email': 'tjones@vmware.com', 'username': 'tracyajones'}, {'_account_id': 7575, 'name': 'Sabari', 'email': 'smurugesan@vmware.com', 'username': 'sabari'}, {'_account_id': 7629, 'name': 'Shawn Hartsock', 'email': 'hartsock@acm.org', 'username': 'hartsocks'}, {'_account_id': 7693, 'name': 'Sidharth Surana', 'email': 'ssurana@vmware.com', 'username': 'ssurana'}, {'_account_id': 8027, 'name': 'Vui Lam', 'email': 'vui@vmware.com', 'username': 'vui'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2013-09-19 00:29:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/fake.py'], 'message': "VMWare: Disabling linked clone doesn't cache images

This fixes an issue when use_linked_clone is false and the image is
already in the cache.  The problem was that the image would be
copied from glance into the instance directory even if it was already
in the cache.  This change checks if the file is in the cache, only
copies from glance if it is not, and copies the image from the cache
into the instance directory if use_linked_clone is false.

Fixes: bug #1207064
Change-Id: If3a84fda3a2a34f0a4aca3946d0a274f44059eab
"}]
commit_message:
VMWare: Disabling linked clone doesn't cache images

This fixes an issue when use_linked_clone is false and the image is
already in the cache.  The problem was that the image would be
copied from glance into the instance directory even if it was already
in the cache.  This change checks if the file is in the cache, only
copies from glance if it is not, and copies the image from the cache
into the instance directory if use_linked_clone is false.

Fixes: bug #1207064
Change-Id: If3a84fda3a2a34f0a4aca3946d0a274f44059eab

commit_message:
Neutron ovs plugin should not require vswitch::ovs

I don't see any reason openvswitch components should be required on the same
machine than the neutron ovs *plugin*. It is definitely required for the
neutron ovs *agent* though.

Change-Id: I1d7128f8a79d788b48af4acf504d48a19e8fe12b

commit_message:
Neutron ovs plugin should not require vswitch::ovs

I don't see any reason openvswitch components should be required on the same
machine than the neutron ovs *plugin*. It is definitely required for the
neutron ovs *agent* though.

Conflicts:
	manifests/plugins/ovs.pp

Change-Id: I1d7128f8a79d788b48af4acf504d48a19e8fe12b

commit_message:
Force textmode consoles

Physical hardware often has console interception hardware for OOB
monitoring/management. Prevent the kernel from switching to a graphical
console mode so the hardware can do its job.

Related-Bug: #1178112
Change-Id: If6d36461f3bd4cc3e32877b6810035b5c5ac69f3

commit_message:
Changes documentation hyperlinks to be relative

On the "System Architecture" page of the developer documentation there
are hyperlinks to sections of the API documentation. These hyperlinks
assumed that the documentation has been placed in the web root and
did not work for documentation in a subdirectory. The hyperlinks
were changed to be relative.

Fixes bug: #1206569

Change-Id: Id2bffbeaba1a41f7e9f76f7eb5a849d66703a7e7

commit_message:
Adding multi-node DevStack template for Ubuntu

Adding a template that deploys a multi-node OpenStack installation using
DevStack. This template has been tested on Ubuntu and may work as-is on
Debian too.

Note that the security group resources require to use Neutron and Havana
Heat.

Change-Id: Ibdf4fe7407913f75b2253b09639554c013d31c01

There were server methods using during spawn that are only used
internally, but not named that way. They have been renamed in this
change.

There were also several methods that are currently called in a single
place, but had logic around the call that should have been inside that
method. This has been tided up, so it will be easier to re-use and/or
move those calls in future refactoring.

This is one of the building blocks towards sharing more code between

Change-Id: I424daf8334ad9904572b9df511d8e6bc1ff6d21f
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: tidy ups to some spawn related methods

There were server methods using during spawn that are only used
internally, but not named that way. They have been renamed in this
change.

There were also several methods that are currently called in a single
place, but had logic around the call that should have been inside that
method. This has been tided up, so it will be easier to re-use and/or
move those calls in future refactoring.

This is one of the building blocks towards sharing more code between
spawn and finish_migration.

Change-Id: I424daf8334ad9904572b9df511d8e6bc1ff6d21f

commit_message:
xenapi: move kernel/ramdisk methods to vm_utils

A previous change has now removed the duplication between spawn and
finish_migration, into create_kernel_and_ramdisk. This change moves the
code into vm_utils, and covers the code with some unit tests.

This will makes is easier to share code between spawn and finish_resize
and gives a more logical public interface to vm_utils.

I have also simplified the call to destroy_kernel_ramdisk in spawn so
that can be shared more easily between spawn and finish_migration in a
later change.

Change-Id: I73523d93be0a7afa9fe814af280c582e47064d69

commit_message:
Convert TestCases to NoDBTestCase

NoDBTestCase is faster because it skips initializing a database for
tests which don't actually talk to the database. Its also nicer
because its more explicit about the dependancies of a given test.
This is a first pass at moving test cases over to the database
lacking version, but further work is required here.

Change-Id: Ia28de4ebea4f354cba06bcdc66bb01d4b332943a
Partial-Bug: 1227473

commit_message:
Change daemon Pidfile class to not use root_helper

Some users of the Pidfile class don't specify root_helper,
which then defaults to 'sudo', which will generate an error.
Remove root_helper altogether since we actually don't need
root priveleges to read /proc/$pid/cmdline.

Changed code to use open.readline() instead of a shell, and
tweaked tests accordingly.

Also cleaned-up the rootwrap filters that allow it as they
are not used anymore.

Fixes bug 1218142

Change-Id: I6691feb1c9f7bfa261a7ec464fd8f3f92168c302

If no image is selected when launching an instance, we will get

It also changes the menu to display "No images available" if

commit_message:
Update error messeages in Launch Instance

If no image is selected when launching an instance, we will get
an error message "There are no image sources available; you must
first create an image before attempting to launch an instance."
In most cases this message is displayed when a user forget to
select an image. This commit changes the error message more generic
to avoid unnecessary confusion.

Closes-Bug: #1225755

It also changes the menu to display "No images available" if
no images are available rather than "Selct image" with no choice.

Change-Id: Ie5dd0760349c8b030baa2b2465776d0fa6c1767f

subject: Fix handling of floating IP association info in Nicira plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-09-13 14:21:11.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/nicira/NeutronPlugin.py'], 'message': 'Fix handling of floating IP association info in Nicira plugin

Bug 1223902

This patch fixes the _update_fix_assoc routine in the Nicira plugin,
ensuring the association of a floating IP with a router is removed
when the floating IP is disassociated.
This patch also adds a unit test for validating behaviour when a floating
IP is associated to a port on a different router, which was an
uncovered use case. This new unit test required some refactoring in
test_l3_plugin.py.

Change-Id: Ibfd53a637f4d14a368b0aeff289c15f993df58dd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix handling of floating IP association info in Nicira plugin

Bug 1223902

This patch fixes the _update_fix_assoc routine in the Nicira plugin,
ensuring the association of a floating IP with a router is removed
when the floating IP is disassociated.
This patch also adds a unit test for validating behaviour when a floating
IP is associated to a port on a different router, which was an
uncovered use case. This new unit test required some refactoring in
test_l3_plugin.py.

Change-Id: Ibfd53a637f4d14a368b0aeff289c15f993df58dd

subject: Bugfix for ConfigManagers: defauls overwriting
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-09-19 20:32:49.000000000', 'files': ['rally/benchmark/config.py'], 'message': 'Bugfix for ConfigManagers: defauls overwriting

In the previos version the read_from_dict() method of the test ConfigManager
classes did not overwrite the already existing options by default, which
resulted in the incorrect TestEngine.bind() behavious. This patch fixes this
issue, adds comments to the ConfigManager class and also makes one small
styllistic improvement in TestConfigManager.

Change-Id: Ie5943e6837405719694659d93912b6153601f878
Closes-Bug: #1227864
'}]
commit_message:
Bugfix for ConfigManagers: defauls overwriting

In the previos version the read_from_dict() method of the test ConfigManager
classes did not overwrite the already existing options by default, which
resulted in the incorrect TestEngine.bind() behavious. This patch fixes this
issue, adds comments to the ConfigManager class and also makes one small
styllistic improvement in TestConfigManager.

Change-Id: Ie5943e6837405719694659d93912b6153601f878
Closes-Bug: #1227864

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}, {'_account_id': 6661, 'name': 'Burt Holzman', 'email': 'holzman@gmail.com', 'username': 'burt'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7040, 'name': 'GuoHui LIu', 'email': 'liuguohui@gmail.com', 'username': 'guohliu'}, {'_account_id': 7629, 'name': 'Shawn Hartsock', 'email': 'hartsock@acm.org', 'username': 'hartsocks'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-09-19 00:21:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/integrated/test_multiprocess_api.py'], 'message': 'MultiprocessWSGITest wait for workers to die bug

MultiprocessWSGITest.test_terminate_sigterm
fails because the wait for workers to die is unreliable.

Parent process can now wait on child or grand-child
processes to complete before moving on. This allows
for grand-child (aka worker) processes to take as much
time as they need to shutdown. NOTE: If the processes
still take too long, they will be killed by the test
framework throwing the "TIMEOUT" exception.

Reverts to using a ping signal to child process
to determine if the child process is live. Waits for
the signal call to fail, signaling process death.

closes bug #1218133

Change-Id: I08e17005508fe412f462773f9ab212cf0f10382f
'}]
commit_message:
MultiprocessWSGITest wait for workers to die bug

MultiprocessWSGITest.test_terminate_sigterm
fails because the wait for workers to die is unreliable.

Parent process can now wait on child or grand-child
processes to complete before moving on. This allows
for grand-child (aka worker) processes to take as much
time as they need to shutdown. NOTE: If the processes
still take too long, they will be killed by the test
framework throwing the "TIMEOUT" exception.

Reverts to using a ping signal to child process
to determine if the child process is live. Waits for
the signal call to fail, signaling process death.

closes bug #1218133

Change-Id: I08e17005508fe412f462773f9ab212cf0f10382f

commit_message:
Enable fake driver can live migration

Now two methods of virt/fake.py does not implemented
1) ensure_filtering_rules_for_instance
2) unfilter_instance

Also the method live_migration does not call
post_live_migration_at_destination, this will cause compute
driver has no chance to update task state for the VM in DB.

Fix bug 1223090

Change-Id: I2fe552faa5f73b47b97e8fefc5c4de04d6785f8c

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5652, 'name': 'David Ripton', 'email': 'dripton@redhat.com', 'username': 'dripton'}, {'_account_id': 7128, 'name': 'Mark Vanderwiel', 'email': 'vanderwl@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kramvan'}, {'_account_id': 7494, 'name': 'Guangya Liu', 'email': 'gyliu513@gmail.com', 'username': 'JayLau'}, {'_account_id': 7664, 'name': 'Joe Cropper', 'email': 'jwcroppe@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'jwcroppe'}, {'_account_id': 7758, 'name': 'David Xie', 'email': 'david.scriptfan@gmail.com', 'username': 'davidx'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-09-11 14:02:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', 'nova/tests/test_exception.py'], 'message': 'Wrong arguments when calling safe_utils.getcallargs()

When calling safe_utils.getcallargs(), it will get all argnames from
definition of a function. As every function in Nova has a argument named
`context`, so argnames will always start with `context`.

In nova/exception.py#81, *args is a list of arguments which does not
start with
`context`, however, argnames starts with `context`, this will lead to a
mismatching when zip it into a dict.

Solution for this is that when calling getcallargs(), pass context as
one argument.

Change-Id: I4ce81e1862fb2d741f15747b04aa6bf1a2243364
Fixes: bug #1207153
'}]
commit_message:
Wrong arguments when calling safe_utils.getcallargs()

When calling safe_utils.getcallargs(), it will get all argnames from
definition of a function. As every function in Nova has a argument named
`context`, so argnames will always start with `context`.

In nova/exception.py#81, *args is a list of arguments which does not
start with
`context`, however, argnames starts with `context`, this will lead to a
mismatching when zip it into a dict.

Solution for this is that when calling getcallargs(), pass context as
one argument.

Change-Id: I4ce81e1862fb2d741f15747b04aa6bf1a2243364
Fixes: bug #1207153

commit_message:
Creates multiple worker processes for API server

This change to the WSGI code uses openstack.common.service to create
multiple worker processes to handle API load.  The main process will
start up a configurable (workers=??) number of child processes which
will all listen on the bind port.

Implement blueprint multi-workers-for-api-server

Change-Id: I1d9b183e1ad8d172584e83ae67524e505e0f425f

commit_message:
Refactor threshold evaluator

This change creates a base class for evaluator.

The alarm service load all evaluators.
A evaluator needs to implement abstract method of this base class.

The alarm service now check in alarm.type use the right extension to
evaluate the alarm.

The previous threshold evaluator code has been moved into the threshold
extension.

Related to blueprint alarming-logical-combination

Change-Id: If6057b7db1e894333e6e9f1edb41ab75bc2c4444

subject: Security Group Rule's To/From/Protocol Ignored
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 694, 'name': 'Tim Simpson', 'email': 'tim.simpson@rackspace.com', 'username': 'tim-simpson'}, {'_account_id': 739, 'name': 'Michael Basnight', 'email': 'mbasnight@gmail.com', 'username': 'hubcap'}, {'_account_id': 1925, 'name': 'Vipul Sabhaya', 'email': 'vipuls@gmail.com', 'username': 'vipuls'}, {'_account_id': 7092, 'name': 'Deprecated Trove CI', 'email': 'reddwarf-jenkins@googlegroups.com', 'username': 'reddwarf', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8214, 'name': 'Auston McReynolds', 'email': 'amcreynolds@ebaysf.com', 'username': 'amcreynolds'}, {'_account_id': 8415, 'name': 'Denis M.', 'email': 'lildee1991@gmail.com', 'username': 'dmakogon'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2013-09-04 21:19:02.000000000', 'files': ['trove/extensions/security_group/service.py'], 'message': "Security Group Rule's To/From/Protocol Ignored

A Security Group Rule can be created via the CLI like so:

$ trove-cli secgroup add_rule --secgroup_id 2263 --protocol tcp \
    --from_port 88 --to_port 88 --cidr 0.0.0.0/0

From the blueprint (bp/security-groups), it seems the intent was to
support multiple rules for a security group. However, the add_rule
method completely disregards the from_port, to_port, and protocol
values, instead opting for the defaults set in the CONF.

Changes:

- All add_rule arguments are now required (no defaults)
- Schema validation is now enabled for add_rule (prior to this
  changeset, the validation was never ran due to the 'create' action
  missing in the schema)
- to_port/from_port validation has been enhanced to detect invalid
  ranges, as well as support regex approved numeric strings.

Closes-Bug: #1199623
Change-Id: I7466046c4641c22e5be30467e68953e0e0582fa6
"}]
commit_message:
Security Group Rule's To/From/Protocol Ignored

A Security Group Rule can be created via the CLI like so:

$ trove-cli secgroup add_rule --secgroup_id 2263 --protocol tcp \
    --from_port 88 --to_port 88 --cidr 0.0.0.0/0

From the blueprint (bp/security-groups), it seems the intent was to
support multiple rules for a security group. However, the add_rule
method completely disregards the from_port, to_port, and protocol
values, instead opting for the defaults set in the CONF.

Changes:

- All add_rule arguments are now required (no defaults)
- Schema validation is now enabled for add_rule (prior to this
  changeset, the validation was never ran due to the 'create' action
  missing in the schema)
- to_port/from_port validation has been enhanced to detect invalid
  ranges, as well as support regex approved numeric strings.

Closes-Bug: #1199623
Change-Id: I7466046c4641c22e5be30467e68953e0e0582fa6

commit_message:
Alarm API update

This updates the alarm API to match the latest discussion:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Ceilometer/blueprints/alarm-api

It allows creation of different kinds of alarm.
The current kind of alarm has been named 'threshold'.

It move the defaults values from the storage models to the API
with all tools provided by wsme to ensure mandatory field and default.

A behavior change, it is now mandatory to PUT a full alarm description
in a PUT call.
In the future a new endpoint can be added to allow to modify only one
field (example for state: /v2/alarms/<id>/state)

Implements blueprint alarming-logical-combination

Change-Id: Ib85636728d427cdb70ef530ff9ff20d2b75c5ed1

commit_message:
Fix ovs-vsctl call in add_tunnel_port()

When a new GRE tunnel is created OVS agent calls ovs-vsctl
incorrectly. Command:

    sudo ovs-vsctl --timeout=2 --may-exist add-port br-tun gre-1

is produced instead of correct one:

   sudo ovs-vsctl --timeout=2 -- --may-exist add-port br-tun gre-1

Fixes bug 1227675

Change-Id: I010961658a37028e41621c4a529b5a14e7587c7f

subject: Send notification for any updates to instance objects
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 688, 'name': 'Sandy Walsh', 'email': 'sandy.walsh@rackspace.com', 'username': 'sandy-walsh'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7899, 'name': 'Kun Ge', 'email': 'gekun@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'gekun'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-09-19 17:23:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/objects/test_instance.py', 'nova/objects/instance.py'], 'message': 'Send notification for any updates to instance objects

Before objects, a notification would be sent for any change to an
instance and the notifications.send_update method would handle any
filtering that needed to be done prior to sending the event.

Currently, the instance objects code is pre-filtering the notification
by only checking if vm_state or task_state changed which is a
regression.

This patch removes the filter in the instance objects code so that
notifications are again sent for any changes to the instance and lets
the notifications.send_update method handle the event as it did before.

Closes-Bug: #1220186

Change-Id: Ib6ceedfe55b021be0fe7fa910e97d46c0cd8f0cd
'}]
commit_message:
Send notification for any updates to instance objects

Before objects, a notification would be sent for any change to an
instance and the notifications.send_update method would handle any
filtering that needed to be done prior to sending the event.

Currently, the instance objects code is pre-filtering the notification
by only checking if vm_state or task_state changed which is a
regression.

This patch removes the filter in the instance objects code so that
notifications are again sent for any changes to the instance and lets
the notifications.send_update method handle the event as it did before.

Closes-Bug: #1220186

Change-Id: Ib6ceedfe55b021be0fe7fa910e97d46c0cd8f0cd

subject: Provide Neutron password in compute metadata
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-09-19 15:39:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova-compute-instance.yaml'], 'message': "Provide Neutron password in compute metadata

overcloud compute node makes requests to Neutron API
and requires quantum_admin_password option of nova.conf
to be set (it is defined in nova image element like
quantum_admin_password={{neutron.service-password}}).

Without this, booting of a user instance in overcloud
fails, because nova-compute service can't authorize
requests to Neutron API.

Change-Id: Ie726d0c3d54abc6c24a45fde3f5af03fd2cf9e37
"}]
commit_message:
Provide Neutron password in compute metadata

overcloud compute node makes requests to Neutron API
and requires quantum_admin_password option of nova.conf
to be set (it is defined in nova image element like
quantum_admin_password={{neutron.service-password}}).

Without this, booting of a user instance in overcloud
fails, because nova-compute service can't authorize
requests to Neutron API.

Change-Id: Ie726d0c3d54abc6c24a45fde3f5af03fd2cf9e37

commit_message:
Use openstack-images-v2.1-json-patch for update method

image.patch returns a JSON schema Draft 10 (application/openstack-images-v2.1-json-patch)
while the glaceclient update method specify a Content-Type header
application/openstack-images-v2.0-json-patch with correspond to a JSON schemea Draft 4.

Fixes bug 1206095
Change-Id: I8c5a96f0e117a81b5b527a96ef45758fc69b518d

subject: perf: Partition messages collection by project
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-09-11 21:25:55.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'tests/unit/storage/test_impl_mongodb.py', 'tests/unit/storage/base.py', 'marconi/storage/mongodb/claims.py', 'marconi/storage/mongodb/messages.py', 'marconi/storage/mongodb/driver.py'], 'message': 'perf: Partition messages collection by project

This patch moves the project name out of the individual message documents
by creating per-project message collections instead. This reduces
the size and complexity of message indexes, as well as increasing the
performance of queries. Furthermore, it will make it more likely that
collections and associated indexes for busy projects are retained in
RAM when memory pressure forces paging.

Change-Id: I3c6a4937cc5735866c108c5a3323a3ea03553773
Implements: blueprint partition-messages-collection
'}]
commit_message:
perf: Partition messages collection by project

This patch moves the project name out of the individual message documents
by creating per-project message collections instead. This reduces
the size and complexity of message indexes, as well as increasing the
performance of queries. Furthermore, it will make it more likely that
collections and associated indexes for busy projects are retained in
RAM when memory pressure forces paging.

Change-Id: I3c6a4937cc5735866c108c5a3323a3ea03553773
Implements: blueprint partition-messages-collection

subject: Neutron nicira plugin: set up connectivity with public network
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-09-19 16:25:50.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_thirdparty/nicira'], 'message': "Neutron nicira plugin: set up connectivity with public network

When spinning devstack with the Neutron and the Nicira plugin, the public
bridge is not configured since the external network will be implemented
on the NVP gateway appliance.

This patch therefore configures an IP address for the devstack interface
on the NVP gateway's uplink network thus providing IP connectivity with
the Neutron external network configured by devstack.
The configured IP address is the external network's gateway, in
accordance with similar setting for OVS-based plugins.

This patch also ensures the IP address is configured when devstack
is shut down.

Bug #1227757

Change-Id: I971eb75548af23c2c77506d48eabd49f2ddb7348
"}]
commit_message:
Neutron nicira plugin: set up connectivity with public network

When spinning devstack with the Neutron and the Nicira plugin, the public
bridge is not configured since the external network will be implemented
on the NVP gateway appliance.

This patch therefore configures an IP address for the devstack interface
on the NVP gateway's uplink network thus providing IP connectivity with
the Neutron external network configured by devstack.
The configured IP address is the external network's gateway, in
accordance with similar setting for OVS-based plugins.

This patch also ensures the IP address is configured when devstack
is shut down.

Bug #1227757

Change-Id: I971eb75548af23c2c77506d48eabd49f2ddb7348

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2013-09-18 22:40:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/215_fix_deleted_compute_node_stats.py', 'nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Prune node stats at compute node delete time

This commit addresses the situation in which a compute node is deleted, but
its compute node stats still remain in the database as **not** deleted. This
causes ill side effects in compute_node_get_all when it's retrieving host stats
as it doesn't expect there to be compute node stats for which there is no
corresponding compute node (i.e., causing some nodes' stats to be empty).

As such, when a compute node is deleted, its stats should also be implicitly
deleted.

The new test case that's been created fails without the code changes, which
illustrates the problem that compute node stats are empty when they should
not be.

Also included is a simple DB migration script that will update old stats that
were not marked soft-deleted as they should have been.

Change-Id: Ief0f7cf1a506e71898b5a45a0513d34167432d67
Closes-Bug: #1224712
"}]
commit_message:
Prune node stats at compute node delete time

This commit addresses the situation in which a compute node is deleted, but
its compute node stats still remain in the database as **not** deleted. This
causes ill side effects in compute_node_get_all when it's retrieving host stats
as it doesn't expect there to be compute node stats for which there is no
corresponding compute node (i.e., causing some nodes' stats to be empty).

As such, when a compute node is deleted, its stats should also be implicitly
deleted.

The new test case that's been created fails without the code changes, which
illustrates the problem that compute node stats are empty when they should
not be.

Also included is a simple DB migration script that will update old stats that
were not marked soft-deleted as they should have been.

Change-Id: Ief0f7cf1a506e71898b5a45a0513d34167432d67
Closes-Bug: #1224712

In addition, the prerequisites for Fedora/RHEL were modified, because
