commit_message:
Updates documentation for tox use

In order to create a virtualenv with tox, a postgresql package is needed
as a prerequisite. The dev-quickstart documentation has been updated to
reflect this.

In addition, the prerequisites for Fedora/RHEL were modified, because
mysql-devel is needed, not mysql-libs.

Fixes bug: #1227390

Change-Id: Ibfdb0a9a3d560fcc3fb7d95aaa1d765ed18215e2

only print() functions.

Fixes bug 1226943

commit_message:
Adds drivers for marconi proxy storage

This adds a mongodb and a memory storage driver for managing a marconi
proxy catalogue. The memory driver is used by default, though it is
only suitable for testing purposes.

Requests are now also round-robin'd properly, rather than set once
based on queue.

Unit tests were added that give significant coverage of current and
future proxy storage driver implementations. These mirror the
conventions established by tests/unit/queues/storage, and add a
configuration file 'etc/wsgi_proxy_mongodb.conf'. The 'marconi_proxy'
DB is used by default.

Four new test helpers are introduced, all context_managers
- entry
- entries
- partition
- partitions

BREAKING CHANGE: proxy.utils.node
* rewrote weighted_select to be more functional, storage-independent
* rewrote round_robin to be more functional, storage-independent
* rationale: so that storage drivers can use this as needed

BREAKING CHANGE: removed caching
BREAKING CHANGE: removed round robin index from storage
BREAKING CHANGE: proxy.utils.helpers
* removed cruft functions
* updated forward to require only host and request

BREAKING CHANGE: storage interface
* updated to reflect actual usage of storage controllers

This patchset also updates the app and all resources to use the new
storage controllers.

Also fixes various resource bugs:
- nodes -> hosts
- try/except on catalogue entries -> NotFound
- sort memory storage listing by queue name / partition name

Change-Id: If628f5ac74a340f613b65b695d72a62de5453566
Implements: blueprint placement-service

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2013-09-16 13:09:21.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/vmware/volumeops.py', 'cinder/tests/test_vmware_vmdk.py'], 'message': "VMware driver: Fix for invalid datastore selection

Added filter to ignore datastores that are not mounted, in-accessible
and read-only for volume creation. Without this VMware's VC/ESX driver can
choose such datastore with higher invalid capacity value as returned by the
server for volume creation.

Also using parent's self.mox object in the test cases rather than creating
a new mox.Mox obj everytime.

Fixes bug: 1220217

Change-Id: If8319562ddc11fc31eb928b3807aead2b11b94bc
"}]
commit_message:
VMware driver: Fix for invalid datastore selection

Added filter to ignore datastores that are not mounted, in-accessible
and read-only for volume creation. Without this VMware's VC/ESX driver can
choose such datastore with higher invalid capacity value as returned by the
server for volume creation.

Also using parent's self.mox object in the test cases rather than creating
a new mox.Mox obj everytime.

Fixes bug: 1220217

Change-Id: If8319562ddc11fc31eb928b3807aead2b11b94bc

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-09-18 06:47:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/firewall/firewall_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/firewall/test_db_firewall.py'], 'message': 'FWaaS - fix reordering of rules in policy

Due to a recent change, reodering of rules within the
same policy was failing. This is fixed by checking if
the rules belong to the same policy we allow reordering.

There was also a missing call to reorder due to which
the position number on the rules was not reflected correctly
after the reordering. This is also fixed.

Closes bug: #1226941

Change-Id: I7f52e8b9d578c290ace3bb615bf68bd213398303
'}]
commit_message:
FWaaS - fix reordering of rules in policy

Due to a recent change, reodering of rules within the
same policy was failing. This is fixed by checking if
the rules belong to the same policy we allow reordering.

There was also a missing call to reorder due to which
the position number on the rules was not reflected correctly
after the reordering. This is also fixed.

Closes bug: #1226941

Change-Id: I7f52e8b9d578c290ace3bb615bf68bd213398303

subject: Fixed incorrect timeout tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-19 14:06:48.000000000', 'files': ['rally/benchmark/utils.py', 'tox.ini', 'tests/benchmark/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Fixed incorrect timeout tests

In this tests string "Timeout" was searched in wrong place.

Also test functions was renamed, and now we run only tests
we need, instead of all tests (see argument -k for pytest).

Also fixed some typos in docstrings and reduced sleep values.

Blueprint test-engine-utils

Change-Id: Ib89f6071fc5d3091ad0c0134a6009f366796cfa3
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed incorrect timeout tests

In this tests string "Timeout" was searched in wrong place.

Also test functions was renamed, and now we run only tests
we need, instead of all tests (see argument -k for pytest).

Also fixed some typos in docstrings and reduced sleep values.

Blueprint test-engine-utils

Change-Id: Ib89f6071fc5d3091ad0c0134a6009f366796cfa3
